DataElement.preferredDefinition: The measurement of the histologic span for LCIS.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: diagnosis of lobular carcinoma in situ (LCIS).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Lobular carcinoma in situ (LCIS, intralobular carcinoma, lobular neoplasia) is characterized by a proliferation of monomorphic cells completely filling the lumina.  The overall lobular architecture is preserved.  LCIS is frequently multifocal (90% in some series) and bilateral.  LCIS seldom becomes invasive, however there is an increased risk of infiltrating ductal adenocarcinoma.  --2002

Concepts.definition: A non-invasive adenocarcinoma of the breast characterized by a proliferation of monomorphic cells completely filling the lumina.  The overall lobular architecture is preserved.  It is frequently multifocal (90% in some series) and bilateral.  It seldom becomes invasive; however there is an increased risk of infiltrating ductal adenocarcinoma.

Property.preferredDefinition: The process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms.

Concepts.definition: The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 3/15/22 jk added "Qualified" RS as part of MCL quarterly content review.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Measurement of the distance or size of a specific histologic type within a tissue specimen.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

Concepts.definition: Pertaining to the combined microscopic physical features of cells and their surrounding extracellular environment in tissues.
Measurement is the determination of the size or magnitude of something.  It is also used ro refer to the result of this act.
